title: Add "Unlock" action to mobile push notifications if account is locked
body:
# Problem

Currently when a user receives a PN, we show a very generic message (no indication of sender, body, etc). This will change in the future (e.g. with https://github.com/status-im/status-react/issues/7043), so it would be good to be more explicit about the fact that we are showing a generic PN message due to the db being locked. Also, since we may receive PNs from users we've since removed from our contacts, we don't want to be subject to receiving endless PNs from users which are not in our contact list. As we won't have access to the contact list if the db is locked, we should only show a notification for the first message received (and update it with a new timestamp every time we receive a new message) and not play any sounds or any other distracting actions for subsequent PNs until the account is unlocked. This can be achieved with https://developer.android.com/reference/android/app/Notification.Builder#setGroupAlertBehavior(int).

# Implementation

One way to fix this is to add a PN action to the PN (`Unlock account`)

# Acceptance Criteria

- Unlock account action is visible on received PN when db is locked on both Android and iOS, and clicking it opens the app on the sign in screen.
- Subsequent PNs received while account is locked don't play new sounds/alerts.
@PombeirP is this issue still relevant?
Yes, it is.
